data.title: Caroline Andretta - 2018 - Field Hockey
data.meta_description:
Caroline Andretta (11) Forward  - Career Statistics
2018 (Stats): Wrapped up her senior campaign with a career-best 32 points on 14 goals and four assists
data.text:
Career Statistics

2018 (Stats): Wrapped up her senior campaign with a career-best 32 points on 14 goals and four assists to earn second team All-South Region recognition ... Ranked second on the squad in points and goals and fourth in assists ... Named to the ACC All-Tournament Team after recording three goals and one assist in two contests … Scored twice against Wake Forest in the ACC semifinals (11/2) … Totaled three points in the regular season finale at Ohio (10/26) ... Notched a point in three straight contests to close the month of September ... Matched her career high with two tallies against James Madison (9/23) ... Tabbed the ACC Offensive Player of the Week Sept. 18 after notching three goals in a pair of wins over No. 12 Syracuse and No. 14 Saint Joseph's ... Had the game winner in a 1-0 shutout of the Orange (9/14) ... Also an honorable mention selection for the NFHCA National Offensive Player of the Week with her performances ... Recorded a goal and an assist in a 4-1 defeat of No. 5 Penn State (9/9), kicking off a three-game scoring streak ... Tallied a goal in back-to-back wins over No. 22 William & Mary and No. 23 Liberty to start the season ... All-ACC Academic Team and NFHCA National Academic Squad.

2017 (Stats): Totaled 15 points on five goals and five assists … Turned in a career-high two goals in a 5-0 shutout of No. 11 Louisville (9/15) … Notched a goal and an assist in an NCAA first round victory over Miami (11/11) … All-ACC Academic Team, ACC Academic Honor Roll and NFHCA National Academic Squad.

2016: Found the back of the cage against No. 13 Liberty (8/28) and Richmond (10/29) … Provided assists against James Madison (9/11) and Boston College (9/30) … NFHCA National Academic Squad and ACC Academic Honor Roll.

2015: Appeared in 19 of 21 contests during Duke's run to the NCAA semifinals … Tallied first goal of collegiate career against Old Dominion (9/20) … NFHCA National Academic Squad and ACC Academic Honor Roll.

Prior to Duke: Represented the United States on the U19 and U17 junior national teams … Helped club team capture USA Field Hockey Festival titles in 2010 and 2013 … U.S. Futures and Futures Elite participant … Member of Futures Elite Championship squad that won a silver medal in 2014 … Also won silver medals in 2010 and 2011 at USA Field Hockey National Futures Championship … Claimed silver medal at 2011 AAU Junior Olympics … Totaled 114 goals and 59 assists at Oak Knoll despite missing sophomore season due to injury … Garnered All-America honors her final year after recording 60 goals and 30 assists … Named her county's player of the year as a senior … Two-time first team all-state selection … Received first honors in the classroom as a senior.

Personal: Born Caroline Frances Andretta Feb. 4, 1997 in Summit, N.J. … Daughter of Donna and Ralph Andretta … Has one sister (Gabby) who plays field hockey for Oak Knoll.
